greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Partial sums of exponential Möbius function, A166234.
comment: Analog of Mertens's function, A002321; conjecture: a(n) > 0.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000

László Tóth, On certain arithmetic functions involving exponential divisors, II, Annales Univ. Sci. Budapest., Sect. Comp., Vol. 27 (2007), pp. 155-166; arXiv preprint, arXiv:0708.3557 [math.NT], 2007-2009.
formula: a(n) ~ c * n, where c = Product_{p prime} (1 + Sum_{k>=2} (mu(k) - mu(k-1))/p^k) = 0.3609447238... (Tóth, 2007). - _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 08 2020
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := MoebiusMu[e]; em[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Accumulate @ Array[em, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 08 2020 *)
program: (PARI) first(n)=my(s); vector(n,k, s+=factorback(apply(moebius, factor(k)[,2]))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015
(PARI) a(n)=sum(k=1,n,factorback(apply(moebius, factor(k)[,2]))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 13 2012
